criteria: Identification of trusted adults and their relationship to the student.
descriptions: Student is unable to identify any trusted adults or incorrectly identifies individuals. Demonstrates no understanding of appropriate relationships for discussing sensitive topics.
Student identifies one trusted adult but struggles to articulate their relationship or the appropriateness of discussing the topic with them.
Student identifies one or two trusted adults and somewhat explains their relationship but lacks clarity on why they are appropriate for such discussions.
Student identifies two or three trusted adults, clearly states their relationship, and gives a basic explanation of why they are appropriate for discussing the cycle of life.

Student identifies multiple trusted adults, thoroughly explains their relationship (parents, guardians, family friends), and articulates clearly why these individuals are appropriate resources for discussing the cycle of life.

Student confidently identifies a diverse range of trusted adults (parents, guardians, mentors, counselors), provides insightful explanations of their relationships, and comprehensively justifies why each is a suitable resource for discussing the cycle of birth, growth, aging, and death, including considerations of comfort, knowledge, and support.
